title: Public transport for the A-League Round 4 - Melbourne Victory V Brisbane Roar: Saturday 9 November 2024
articleContent:
A-League is back at AAMI Park. This matchup is sure to deliver edge-of-your-seat action. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Victory FC takes on Brisbane Roar. Extra services will help you get to and from AAMI Park on Saturday 9th November.

The game will begin at 5pm:

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station:

  • Glen Waverley departing at 7:22pm from Platform 10
  • Ringwood – leaving at 7:16pm from Platform 9
  • Sandringham – leaving at 7:14pm from Platform 2
  • Westall – leaving at 7:28pm from Platform 6
  • Cheltenham – leaving at 7:32pm from Platform 4

Please Note: Buses replace Sunbury line trains between North Melbourne and Sunshine from Saturday 9 November until last service Sunday 10 November.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.  

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to AAMI Park:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.
